data.title: Bill McKean on LinkedIn: With former Democrat Kansas House minority leader Paul Davis as her‚Ä¶
data.meta_description:
With former Democrat Kansas House minority leader Paul Davis as her mentor, what could go wrong for this intelligent, young lobbyist?

To her credit MacKenzie‚Ä¶
data.text:
Congratulations!!!!!! I have watched you grow, flourish into a confident, brilliant young woman. Your unwavering commitment to knowledge, justice, and fairness has always been evident, and it fills my heart with admiration and pride. Law school will undoubtedly test your limits, both intellectually and emotionally. There will be long nights of studying, rigorous debates, and demanding deadlines. But I know that your resilience, intellect, and passion will carry you through. Remember that challenges are the stepping stones to growth, and every obstacle you encounter will shape you into a stronger, more compassionate advocate for justice. As you delve into the vast realm of law, I urge you to remain true to yourself and your values. Let your unwavering integrity be your compass, guiding you through the complexities of the legal landscape.

Officially in print! I'm thrilled to share a snapshot of my name in the University of Illinois' official records, commemorating my Master of Law (LL.M.) degree with honors in Intellectual Property and Technology Law! This moment marks the culmination of hard work, determination, and a passion for learning. I'm grateful for the opportunity to have pursued my interests and to have been part of the University of Illinois community. Here's to many more achievements to come! #LLM #UniversityOfIllinois #IntellectualProperty #TechnologyLaw #AcademicAchievement #ProudMoment"

I am happy to share that last weekend, I graduated from Loyola University Chicago School of Law with my JD. Reflecting on the past three years, I have learned the importance of community and collective activism over individuality and lone success. I can say with absolute certainty that I would not have accomplished what I have academically, professionally, or personally without the endless support from my family, friends, and mentors. I am excited to embark on this new chapter in my legal career, but first: the Bar exam!

Sharing some professional news: I have decided to step down as Dean at the end of June. It has been a great 7 years and I am proud of what our Western Law community has built together. Thanks to all the faculty, staff, students and alumni who make Western Law such a special place. Link to my full message below.

As a Woodruff Debate Scholar, first-year student Kalil Bennett is excited about taking his skills to the next level for the Emory debate team, which ranks as one of the best collegiate teams in the country. He‚Äôs also hoping that his drive to get better at building arguments helps him as he prepares to go into a career in law. ‚û°Ô∏è More about Kalil: https://links.emory.edu/Kx #emoryuniversity #emory #emory2027 #classof2027

As my 2nd semester of 1L begins, I'm looking forward to what all comes in the future and the possible conversations that I can facilitate in the health care space. If you'd like to read more about what I've been up to, this article just came out that highlights some of the reasons why I chose to transition from pre-med to law and specifically why I chose Loyola for law school!

üéì Exciting New Chapter Unfolding! On January 11, 2024, I had the privilege of walking across the stage, donning a cap and gown to officially mark the culmination of an incredible journey - my graduation ceremony. Completing my Master‚Äôs degree with Distinction in a foreign land has been nothing short of surreal. The journey that started with studies concluding in August and results received by October has now been beautifully punctuated by the ceremony, making it all feel undeniably real. Today, as I reflect on this milestone, I can't help but feel an overwhelming sense of pride. As I stand at this crossroads, I eagerly anticipate the next phase of my journey ‚Äì gaining industry experience in the field of law. The classroom has provided a solid foundation, and now I'm eager to apply that knowledge in real-world scenarios. Here's to embracing new beginnings, continuous learning, and the exciting opportunities that lie ahead! I am grateful for the lessons learned, friendships forged, and the unwavering support received throughout this academic odyssey. As I step into the professional realm, I look forward to connecting with like-minded individuals, exploring collaborations, and contributing to the field of law. If you have any insights, opportunities, or just want to connect, feel free to reach out. Cheers to new beginnings, challenges, and triumphs on the horizon! ü•Ç Queen Mary University of London | QMUL School of Law | qLegal - The small print for BIG IDEAS #GraduationDay #NewBeginnings #LawyerInMaking
